email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. Following up on our call earlier, I’m pleased to provide a freight quote for your crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We’re looking at a rate in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton, based on a 100,000 MT cargo size. The vessel we have in mind is the MV Oceanic Star, a modern VLCC with a DWT of 300,000 and LOA of 330 meters. Laycan is tentatively set for October 20-25. Let me know your thoughts. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The rate seems a bit on the higher side given current market conditions. Would you be able to come down to the mid-40s? Also, could you confirm the vessel’s availability for the laycan? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concern about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $48.50 per metric ton, which I believe is competitive. The MV Oceanic Star is still available for the October 20-25 laycan. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $48.50 sounds more reasonable. Let’s proceed with that. Can you confirm the demurrage terms? Also, please ensure the vessel’s ETA at Houston is no later than October 20. Thanks, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear that $48.50 works for you. Demurrage is set at $25,000 per day, pro rata, after 72 hours of laytime. The vessel’s ETA at Houston is confirmed for October 19, so we’re well within your requested window. I’ll send over the recap shortly. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the confirmation. The demurrage terms are acceptable. Please proceed with the recap, and let’s finalize the deal. Looking forward to working with you on this. Cheers, John
